brief_description: Study of Influenza vaccine coupled with adjuvant in Murine model
description: Study of Influenza vaccine coupled with adjuvant in Murine model
endpoints: Blood, spleen, bone marrow and lymph node samples prior to prime, prior to boosting with influenza vaccine with adjuvant and daily sampling up to 10 days post boosting.
hypothesis: To understand and describe the multidimensional murine immune response to influenza vaccine coupled with adjuvant
objectives: Design and conduct in vivo murine experiments with X31(H3N2) infection primed and purified inactivated A/Port Chalmers/1/73 (H3N2) whole virus with MF59-like adjuvant boosted mice to build, identify and experimentally validate the proposed immune response models by generating high frequency sampling and high dimensional datasets.

arm.description: Mice primed with X31 (H3N2) intranasal infection followed by an intramuscular boost with purified inactivated A/Port Chalmers/1/73 (H3N2) whole virus with MF59-like adjuvant.
arm.name: Murine vaccine with adjuvant run

personnel.organization: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling

program.contract_name: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling II
